content: You are good at finding the object in a 3D scene based on a given query description.

These images show different views of a room. You need to find the pillow in this query description: "the pillow on the bed farther from the door. it is the top pillow on the side of the bed that is closer to the table between the beds.". 
Please review all view images to find the target object and select the view that you can see the target object most clearly. 
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified the target object, and why you choose this view.
"view": The number of the view is in the top left corner of the corresponding image. e.g., "view": "2"

The query describes a pillow on the bed that is farther from the door, specifically the top pillow on the side of the bed closer to the table between the beds. In view 1, both beds are visible, and the arrangement of the pillows can be clearly seen. The bed farther from the door is on the right side of the image, and the pillow on the side closer to the table is visible. This view provides a clear perspective of the bed and the pillow arrangement.

Here is the annotated image of the selected view. 
All objects belonging to the pillow class is labeled by a unique number (ID) in red color on it.
Please select the object ID that best matches the given query description: "the pillow on the bed farther from the door. it is the top pillow on the side of the bed that is closer to the table between the beds.".
Carefully analyze the specified conditions (such as shape, color, relative position with surrounding objects) in the given query, then select top-5 best-matched object IDs.
The selected top-5 object IDs should be sorted in descending order of confidence.
The object ID should be chosen from this list [6, 8, 11, 15, 17, 23, 25, 31, 32, 40, 53, 58, 61, 62, 64, 74, 86]
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified and ranked the top-5 target object IDs.
"object_id": A list of5 selected target object IDs. e.g., [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

The query describes a pillow on the bed farther from the door, which is the bed on the right side of the image. It specifies the top pillow on the side of the bed closer to the table between the beds. The table is between the two beds, so the pillow closest to the table on the right bed is the one to identify. The pillow IDs on the right bed are 6, 25, 58, and 64. Among these, ID 6 is the top pillow closest to the table.
